page.title: 01INTRODUCTION - OVERTON
page.content: {Introduction - Overton This block is mainly arable land; only one quarter is developed. It is traversed by the main London - west of England railway line abut the station at Overton in the north-east corner of the block is no longer manned although trains do stop there frequently. The developed area is all in the southern end of the block and comprises two housing estates both less than 10 years old, the Church, the School, a cluster of farm buildings and some farm workers' cottages. The River Test forms a natural boundary to the block on the south-west corner. In the north-east of the block lies Portals Mill the only large industrial site in the village and a major employer.
